meanings.sent2: Lack of exercise can enfeeble the muscles.
meanings.sent3: Trying to carry all those heavy books will only enfeeble you more!
meanings.sent4: The constant stress seemed to enfeeble her resolve.
meanings.sent5: The villain's evil plan aimed to enfeeble the hero's strength.

meanings.definition: To deprive of strength or vigor.
meanings.sent1: The lack of food will enfeeble the body.
meanings.sent2: The exhausting journey enfeebled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent3: Eating only candy will enfeeble your energy levels.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter winds seemed to enfeeble the old tree.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer cast a spell to enfeeble the knight's sword arm.
